definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: But coming up with appropriate dress for this concert was proving to be a problem.
sentences.chinese: 但是要为参加这场音乐会找到得体的衣服可是个问题。

sentences.english: Maybe she dresses well, is efficient or extremely punctual.
sentences.chinese: 比如，夸女孩衣着得体，办事有效率或者是极其守时。

sentences.english: Cor. 14:40 But all things must be done becomingly and in order.
sentences.chinese: 林前十四40凡事都要端正得体的按著次序行。

sentences.english: The children do not know how to behave themselves decently .
sentences.chinese: 小小孩不懂得怎样举止得体。

sentences.english: I wish she was as well-behaved as Darma, one of my other dogs.
sentences.chinese: 我好希望她能跟戴玛一样举止得体。

sentences.english: It is always better to be slightly underdressed.
sentences.chinese: 它总是更好的是有点不得体。

sentences.english: He's an eloquent man, smartly dressed in a three-piece suit.
sentences.chinese: 他口才很好，穿着得体的三件套西服。

sentences.english: Introductions to the experiences of Professor SONG Xin-wei in treating Sjogren's Syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 介绍宋欣伟教授中医中药治疗干燥综合征的心得体会。

sentences.english: A keen awareness of right from wrong is essential for determining appropriate social behavior .
sentences.chinese: 对正误的深刻熟悉是判定得体的社会举动所必需的。

sentences.english: Written case studies in the form of stories or reports can serve to capture the lessons learned during the experimentation process.
sentences.chinese: 以故事或书面报告的形式撰写实验过程中的心得体会。

sentences.english: The only outfit exception: A well-cut suit.
sentences.chinese: 但裁剪得体的套装除外。

sentences.english: His hair is very smooth, very clean and decent clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他头发梳得很顺，衣服穿的很干净得体。

sentences.english: The lady is elegant in her manners and her speech.
sentences.chinese: 那位女士举止言谈优雅得体。

sentences.english: "See, " said Jupiter, to Venus, "how becomingly she behaves.
sentences.chinese: “看，”丘比特对维纳斯说，“她表现得多得体啊。

sentences.english: Boasting about size may be poor form and the sign of an arriviste.
sentences.chinese: 吹嘘规模或许并非得体的行为，也是暴发户的象征。

sentences.english: Her tactless remarks just added fuel to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她那些不得体的话简直是火上加油。

definition: (of one's conduct, speech etc) natural and unrestrained
neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
expert/scholar/mother earth/a type of green tea
dignity/face (as in "losing face")/honorable/creditable/(of sb's appearance) presentable/respectable
